Speaker: ﻿KRATOS
Text: My vengeance ends now.
[Titans led by Kratos siege Olympus. Against this background, Zeus motivating the rest of the gods.]

Speaker: ZEUS
Text: My brothers. We were forged in victory. A victory that ended the great war and brought forth the reign of mount Olympus. Born from the depths of the underworld, rooted in the river of souls, our mountain emerged out of the chaos. As it grew, so too did the might of the Olympians. We created a world of peace, a world of prosperity. A world that lives in the shadow and safety of my mountain. A mountain that has come to be the absolute measure of strength and power. Now, on this day, that power is to be tested. The mortal, Kratos, seeks to destroy all that I have wrought. Brothers, put aside the petty grievances that have splintered us for so long. We will unite. We will stand together. And I will wipe out this plague! Olympus will prevail!
[The gods attacks the titans.]

Speaker: KRATOS
Text: Zeus! Your son has returned. I bring the destruction of Olympus!

Speaker: HELIOS
Text: The titans will fail again!
[Poseidon grabs Gaia with his water horses.]

Speaker: GAIA
Text: Something has me! I cannot move, Kratos. Free me! Kratos! Help me! Hurry, Spartan!
[Kratos fights with Poseidon, making his way to the top of Olympus.]

Speaker: POSEIDON
Text: You challenge me, mortal? A god of Olympus?

Speaker: KRATOS
Text: A true warrior does not hide, Poseidon. Leave the sea and face me.

Speaker: POSEIDON
Text: You have disrespected the gods for the last time, Kratos.

Speaker: GAIA
Text: Jump to my hand!

Speaker: POSEIDON
Text: For the greatness of Olympus!
[Kratos manages to defeat the god of the seas.]

Speaker: POSEIDON
Text: Zeus should have kept you where you belong. No matter how many gods fall, there will always be another to stand against you.

Speaker: KRATOS
Text: They will fall as well.

Speaker: POSEIDON
Text: The death of Olympus means the death of us all.

Speaker: KRATOS
Text: Then prepare for your death, Poseidon.
[He mercilessly beats Poseidon up, pokes his eyes out and dumps the disfigured corpse into the sea. With his death, no one else controls the ocean and it overflows, flooding the whole world.]

Speaker: GAIA
Text: Kratos, the death of Zeus is within our reach! Climb to my hand!
[He rises to the very top and meets Zeus himself.]

Speaker: KRATOS
Text: What will you do, father? You can no longer hide behind the skirts of Athena.

Speaker: ZEUS
Text: Athena is dead because of the rage that consumes you, Kratos. What more will you destroy?

Speaker: KRATOS
Text: The hands of death could not defeat me. The sisters of fate could not hold me. And you will not see the end of this day. I will have my revenge!

Speaker: ZEUS
Text: Petulant child! I will tolerate your insolence no more!
[Zeus pulls out one of his lightning bolts and throws out both Kratos and Gaia.]

Speaker: KRATOS
Text: Gaia! I can hold on no longer!

Speaker: GAIA
Text: If I help you, we will both fall. Even now Zeus gains.

Speaker: KRATOS
Text: The destruction of Zeus is why you saved me from death.

Speaker: GAIA
Text: I saved you to serve the titans.

Speaker: KRATOS
Text: Do not deny me my revenge!

Speaker: GAIA
Text: Listen carefully, Kratos. You were a simple pawn, nothing more. Zeus is no longer your concern. This is our war. Not yours.

Speaker: KRATOS
Text: Gaia!
[He falls to the depths of the underworld.]

Speaker: KRATOS
Text: I have lived as a warrior. I have died as a god. Having suffered the ultimate sacrifice. I have been denied release. I… will defeat Olympus. I will have my revenge.
[Kratos crosses the river Styx, struggling with restless souls floating in it.]

Speaker: KRATOS
Text: We are not finished Zeus. The gates of Hades have never held me.

Speaker: SPIRIT OF ATHENA
Text: Death cannot hold those with purpose, Kratos.

Speaker: KRATOS
Text: Athena?

Speaker: SPIRIT OF ATHENA
Text: I have missed you, Spartan.

Speaker: KRATOS
Text: I... I don't...

Speaker: SPIRIT OF ATHENA
Text: My sacrifice to save Zeus has brought me to a higher existence.

Speaker: KRATOS
Text: You still appear to be an Olympian.

Speaker: SPIRIT OF ATHENA
Text: Appearances can be deceiving, Kratos.

Speaker: KRATOS
Text: So can the children of Olympus.

Speaker: SPIRIT OF ATHENA
Text: Perhaps, but remember, my death came by your blade.

Speaker: KRATOS
Text: My blade was meant for Zeus. Be quick with your words.

Speaker: SPIRIT OF ATHENA
Text: As we speak, the war for Olympus rages on and mankind suffers.

Speaker: KRATOS
Text: Let them suffer. The death of Zeus is all that matters.

Speaker: SPIRIT OF ATHENA
Text: Zeus will not fall as easily as Ares. To destroy the king of the gods, you must seek the source of his strength. The flame of Olympus.

Speaker: KRATOS
Text: You once sacrificed yourself to save Zeus, and now you seek to destroy him? What has brought about this change?

Speaker: SPIRIT OF ATHENA
Text: I see truths where I did not before. Perhaps these will earn back your trust. These are the blades of exile. They will help guide you on your journey to the flame. Remember, as long as Zeus reigns, there is no hope for mankind. Destroy the flame, Kratos, and the very foundations of Olympus will crumble.

Speaker: HADES
Text: I knew you would be back, Spartan. Did you miss me?

Speaker: PEIRITHOUS
Text: I have suffered enough, Spartan. Hades. He sentenced me to this eternal torture. My prison of tinder. But now that you are here, you can free me! All I have left is my bow. Please, free me and it is yours.
[But Kratos, apparently, has other plans...]

Speaker: PEIRITHOUS
Text: What are you doing? Please! I cannot die this way! Please Spartan! Spare me! No, no. Stay away! No, help! Please!
[Kratos saddles a fire-breathing Cerberus and burns Peirithous alive and takes the bow. Next he faces three judges...]

Speaker: JUDGE
Text: By the gods of Olympus and order of Zeus. We are the three judges. Face your final judgement, mortal. King Aeacus has found you wanting. King Rhadamanthus has found you worthy. It falls to me, king Minos, to make the final decision. Your future is cloaked in shadow. The realm of the afterlife is not yet ready for you. Beyond that door waits your destiny.

Speaker: SPIRIT OF A GIRL
Text: Father?

Speaker: KRATOS
Text: Calliope?

Speaker: SPIRIT OF A GIRL
Text: Oh...

Speaker: KRATOS
Text: You are not my daughter.

Speaker: SPIRIT OF A GIRL
Text: No. But I know who you are.

Speaker: KRATOS
Text: You know of me?

Speaker: SPIRIT OF A GIRL
Text: They said you would come...

Speaker: HADES
Text: Playing with toys, Kratos?

Speaker: KRATOS
Text: Show yourself, Hades! Another one of your tricks?

Speaker: HADES
Text: As usual, Spartan, you are gravely mistaken.

Speaker: KRATOS
Text: Face me, coward.

Speaker: HADES
Text: So eager, Kratos. Relax. Soon enough we will have our time to play.
[Kratos finds a huge forge and a tortured giant next to the anvil.]

Speaker: HEPHAESTUS
Text: Leave me be. I tell you... I have paid the price.

Speaker: KRATOS
Text: Calm yourself, smith god.

Speaker: HEPHAESTUS
Text: Ghost of Sparta? It is you... Well, well, well... I thought Zeus would have killed you by now.

Speaker: KRATOS
Text: I thought you would have escaped this cavern by now.

Speaker: HEPHAESTUS
Text: Zeus may have imprisoned me here, but you are the reason I live in torment.

Speaker: KRATOS
Text: I did you no wrong, Hephaestus. I pursue only one Olympian.

Speaker: HEPHAESTUS
Text: Well, as long as it's only one Olympian.

Speaker: KRATOS
Text: I seek the flame of Olympus. Do you know of it?

Speaker: HEPHAESTUS
Text: For what purpose, Spartan?

Speaker: KRATOS
Text: For the purpose I have chosen. Now tell me, do you know of the flame?

Speaker: HEPHAESTUS
Text: All true children of Olympus know of it we have all come to respect its power. But don’t be fooled by its enticing glow. Neither god nor man can touch its lethal flame.

Speaker: KRATOS
Text: I only need to find it.

Speaker: HEPHAESTUS
Text: If you can find your way out of the underworld, I am sure you can find your way to the flame of Olympus.

Speaker: KRATOS
Text: You have been truly helpful, Hephaestus.
[He leaves the forge.]

Speaker: SPIRIT OF A GIRL
Text: Kratos?

Speaker: KRATOS
Text: How do you know of me?

Speaker: SPIRIT OF A GIRL
Text: You’re the Ghost of Sparta. Everyone knows who you are. Everyone is afraid of you.

Speaker: KRATOS
Text: There are reasons for that.

Speaker: SPIRIT OF A GIRL
Text: I'm not afraid of you.

Speaker: KRATOS
Text: It’s good you’re not afraid, child. Fear is a heavy burden.

Speaker: SPIRIT OF A GIRL
Text: I’m not a child, Kratos.

Speaker: KRATOS
Text: It does not matter what you are, my concerns lay elsewhere.

Speaker: SPIRIT OF A GIRL
Text: Kratos, please. I need you to free me.

Speaker: KRATOS
Text: The quest for freedom is also a heavy burden. I cannot help you.
[He leaves and finds a shrine with a huge statue of Hades in the center.]

Speaker: HADES
Text: Welcome, Spartan. Come in. Make yourself at home. This time, you won't be leaving. Now it falls to me to collect payment for the pain you have wrought. Kratos. So glad you could carve out some time for us. You know we need it. I sense some bad blood between us, Kratos. Oh, all the memories. They’re overwhelming. Really, let's see... How many sins have you committed against me? Oh, that's right. You murdered my niece, Athena. And what else. What else? Ah, and you killed my brother, Poseidon. And I have not forgotten that it was you who butchered my beautiful queen! I will see you suffer as I have suffered. Your soul is mine.
[Hades emerges from the shadows and attacks Kratos. Brutal fight begins.]

Speaker: HADES
Text: I am stronger than you'll ever be! I live for pain. Your pain is my pleasure. Your death will only be the beginning of your suffering. Your soul will only make me stronger. I enjoy listening to your pain. The river Styx awaits!
[Kratos severely beats Hades and takes away his chains with hooks, but the god of the dead does not even think to give up.]

Speaker: HADES
Text: Suffer!

[Kratos uses the hooks of Hades and deprives the god of the dead of his own soul. With his death, there is no one to watch over the dead and the souls begin to leave the palaces of the underworld. Kratos returns to the forge.]

Speaker: HEPHAESTUS
Text: Kratos? Can it be? Does this mean lord Hades rules no longer?

Speaker: KRATOS
Text: The goo of the underworld is dead.

Speaker: HEPHAESTUS
Text: Dead? Hades deserved to suffer. Though I thought his death impossible.

Speaker: KRATOS
Text: Olympians overestimate themselves.

Speaker: HEPHAESTUS
Text: Interesting. I will keep that in mind, Spartan. You need the soul of a god to use the Hyperion gate, Kratos. And that one has not been used for centuries. I’m sure it is broken. Otherwise I would have seen my beautiful... You know, Kratos. I wasn't always like this. A monster. I was once the most prized craftsman in all of Olympus. Zeus rewarded me with my marriage the beautiful Aphrodite. My mother, Hera, bragged of my talent. But the day you killed Ares was the day my world was torn from me. That day Zeus became fiend you now know. Worst of all, he took my beloved daughter, Pandora. My reason for living. I spend my time here, trying to recreate her. I fail. Again and again. She still lives, Spartan. I can feel it. You... you Kratos, you can bring her back to me.

Speaker: KRATOS
Text: Your child is not my concern.

Speaker: HEPHAESTUS
Text: But surely you can understand. You were once a father too.
[Without answering, Kratos leaves the forge. The words of Hephaestus are clearly stirred something in the soul of a mighty Spartan.]

Speaker: SPIRIT OF ATHENA
Text: Remember your purpose, Kratos. The twilight is upon us. His death is our only hope.

Speaker: KRATOS
Text: Understand this, Athena. Zeus will die.
[Kratos is entered in the portal and returns to the world of the living. Helios soars in the sky in his chariot of fire.]

Speaker: HELIOS
Text: Forward!
[Soon he finds Gaia. She is barely alive.]

Speaker: GAIA
Text: You live, Spartan? The blood of Cronos served you well. Quickly, you must help me!

Speaker: KRATOS
Text: Help you?

Speaker: GAIA
Text: Yes, child. Quickly! I suffer greatly. I tried to return to battle but...

Speaker: KRATOS
Text: Without me.

Speaker: GAIA
Text: You know I had no choice. You must help me.
[Kratos cuts through the roots with which Gaia holds her mighty body.]

Speaker: GAIA
Text: Kratos. Do I mean nothing to you?

Speaker: KRATOS
Text: You were a means to the end, Gaia. Nothing more.

Speaker: GAIA
Text: But I must face Zeus. The titans must take down Olympus.

Speaker: KRATOS
Text: No! This is my war. Not yours.
[He pierces Gaia with the sword of Olympus and throws her down. Going further, he meets Helios, fighting with one of the titans.]

Speaker: HELIOS
Text: Behold the glory of Helios! Feel the wrath of the sun!
[Kratos uses a ballista and knocks down Helios from the sky.]

Speaker: HELIOS
Text: Forward! Help me! My home! Everything I have. Destroyed! Kratos I have not forgotten the debt I owe you. Save me now as you once saved me from atlas. And I promise to repay you in full.

Speaker: KRATOS
Text: If you wish to repay me, tell me where I can find the flame of Olympus!

Speaker: HELIOS
Text: The flame? You will never defeat Zeus. Spartan you will forfeit your life in trying.

Speaker: KRATOS
Text: Of all the lives you should worry about, Helios, mine is not one of them.

Speaker: HELIOS
Text: Feel the power of the sun! Wait! Wait! I can tell you that to destroy Zeus you must step into the flame to receive its power.

Speaker: KRATOS
Text: You lie, Helios! Hephaestus told me the flame kills all who touch it.

Speaker: HELIOS
Text: And you believe him? That freak has fallen from the graces of Olympus!

Speaker: KRATOS
Text: That is exactly why I believe him.

Speaker: HELIOS
Text: My death will not lead you to Zeus.

Speaker: KRATOS
Text: That is where you are wrong.
[Kratos tears off Helios's head with his bare hands. Killing the god of light, he deprived the whole world of the sun. Lighting his way with the head of Helios, he goes further.]

Speaker: SPIRIT OF A GIRL
Text: Kratos! It’s getting close.

Speaker: KRATOS
Text: I told you. I cannot help you.

Speaker: SPIRIT OF A GIRL
Text: But you’re the only one who can. I know it. I trust you.

Speaker: KRATOS
Text: You shouldn’t.

Speaker: HERMES
Text: Oh. Look who it is. Kratos. The Ghost of Sparta. The fallen god. The cursed mortal.

Speaker: KRATOS
Text: To catch a fly from the ass of Zeus is not worth my time Hermes.

Speaker: HERMES
Text: A coward's words, Kratos. You don't try to catch me because you know you can’t. Kratos, where are you off to today? Kill any family members lately? Oh. That's right. You’re off to kill your father, Zeus. Won’t happen can’t happen Kratos is on a fool's errand. Again! Never, never learn. Never, never change. Kratos, the fool who killed his own blood. Kratos, the fool among mortals and gods. Forever, ever cursed. Forever, ever doomed. Consumed by vengeance to his last breath. The Spartan lights the way to dusty death.
[He runs away. Soon Kratos finds Pandora's box, standing in flames. He slowly pulls his hand to it.]

Speaker: KRATOS
Text: Pandora’s box?  what’s the meaning of this?

Speaker: SPIRIT OF ATHENA
Text: Our eyes do not deceive you, Kratos. It is the same box you opened years ago. The power to kill a god still rests inside.

Speaker: KRATOS
Text: I released those powers when I killed Ares.

Speaker: SPIRIT OF ATHENA
Text: No. Trapped inside that box there is a stronger power. It has been missing from the world. It all began when Zeus triumphed over the titans in the great war. Zeus understood that the evils born from that battle, if left free would destroy the world of man and gods. To contain these evils, Zeus commissioned Hephaestus to build a vessel strong enough to hold them. Fear. Greed. He locked them all away in the box in hopes that they would never again infect his reign. When you opened the box to kill Ares. You drew from the forbidden powers. After witnessing your victory, fear gripped Zeus.

Speaker: KRATOS
Text: But the flame is deadly. How can I recover the box?

Speaker: SPIRIT OF ATHENA
Text: With its namesake Kratos.

Speaker: KRATOS
Text: Pandora?

Speaker: SPIRIT OF ATHENA
Text: She is the key to destroying the flame. The key to our revenge. This will be difficult, Spartan.

Speaker: KRATOS
Text: A simple child will not trouble me, Athena.

Speaker: SPIRIT OF ATHENA
Text: I hope you are right, Ghost of Sparta.

Speaker: HERMES
Text: You may have brute force, but you lack speed.
[The pursuit of the god of mischief begins.]

Speaker: HERMES
Text: You’ve been lucky in battle, Spartan. But your luck ends today. What makes you think you can ever catch me? I’m slipping! I can’t hold on! Isn’t this fun? Keep up, Kratos!
[Finally, Kratos overtakes Hermes.]

Speaker: HERMES
Text: I thought Spartans fought with honour. And yet you seek to kill me when I have no way to defend myself? Not fair. But you have your own sense of honour. Right, Kratos? And what has that honour brought you? Nothing but nightmAres of your failure. Today you may defeat me. But in the end. Kratos. In the end you'll betray only yourself.
[Hermes' fiery speech makes no impression on Kratos. He starts to cut.]

Speaker: HERMES
Text: Leave me alone! Go away!
[Kratos takes the sandals from Hermes... With his legs. As Hermes dies, the world also loses something... Apparently merchants and thieves.]

Speaker: DRANK WOMAN
Text: Bravo. Bravo. Our hero has arrived. Applause for another bastard child of Zeus. Just in time for the final act.

Speaker: KRATOS
Text: Hera.

Speaker: HERA
Text: You look terrible, dear. Still wanting to kill my husband; I suppose?

Speaker: KRATOS
Text: You know I seek revenge on Zeus.

Speaker: HERA
Text: Can’t say that I blame you. Since you killed my son, Ares, fear of you consumes him.

Speaker: KRATOS
Text: His fears will not matter when he is dead.

Speaker: HERA
Text: I’ll drink to that.

Speaker: KRATOS
Text: Hera. I seek the child Pandora.

Speaker: HERA
Text: Pandora? That wretched little thing my son Hephaestus created? Well, we can’t have you do that, my dear. Destroy him.

Speaker: HERCULES
Text: Hello, brother.

Speaker: KRATOS
Text: This is not between us, Hercules.

Speaker: HERCULES
Text: Isn't it? You were always Zeus' favourite.

Speaker: KRATOS
Text: The air on Olympus affects your thinking, brother. Zeus has no favourites.

Speaker: HERCULES
Text: Think about it brother. While I was stuck cleaning the Augean stables, he chose you to destroy Ares. Not convinced? How about this? While you were being crowned the god of war, I was sent to an apple. They called them labours. Hah! Perhaps he did allow me to kill the Nemean lion, but he made your name known amongst the people. A fierce warrior. A killer made hero. A man made a god. But this time, brother, this time I will destroy you. Call it my thirteenth and final labour. Soon I will become the god of war and claim the throne for myself.

Speaker: KRATOS
Text: You aspire to be an Olympian, yet their reign is ending, Hercules.

Speaker: HERCULES
Text: We’ll see about that. I’ll take care of him myself!
[Fateful battle between the two brothers begins.]

Speaker: HERCULES
Text: Armour is for weaklings. Kill the bastard' do you see how he trembles? Finally. A challenge.
[Kratos wins and smashes Hercules' face with such force that the floor under him cracks. Kratos falls into the sewer.]

Speaker: KRATOS
Text: Pandora?

Speaker: PANDORA
Text: Kratos. I knew you'd come back.

Speaker: KRATOS
Text: Tell me where you are.

Speaker: PANDORA
Text: I hear something. He’s close.

Speaker: KRATOS
Text: Just tell me how to find you.

Speaker: PANDORA
Text: The labyrinth... Find the lab… help! Help! Kratos!

Speaker: KRATOS
Text: Pandora? Pandora! What’s happened? Where are you?

Speaker: ZEUS
Text: My son. You trifle with matters you cannot possibly understand. Stay away from this... This... Thing!

Speaker: KRATOS
Text: Zeus! Zeus!
[Kratos returns to the forge of Hephaestus through the portal.]

Speaker: HEPHAESTUS
Text: Aphrodite? I knew you would return to me… Kratos? Tell me, has Aphrodite conquered another god of war?

Speaker: KRATOS
Text: That is a question you should ask your wife. I seek the labyrinth.

Speaker: HEPHAESTUS
Text: I thought you sought only the flame. What could you possibly want in... No stay away from her! Stay away from Pandora. Kratos' you are the reason she is in the labyrinth! The reason I live here in hell!

Speaker: KRATOS
Text: I have done you no wrong, Hephaestus!

Speaker: HEPHAESTUS
Text: Oh. But you have, Spartan. You opened the box.

Speaker: KRATOS
Text: I did what had to be done.

Speaker: HEPHAESTUS
Text: Clearly you don't understand. The evils of the great war could not easily be contained. I forged the box in a power greater than the gods themselves. The flame of Olympus. As the raw metal took shape, I realised the flame was the safest place to protect it. The lock was set all that, was needed was a key. A way to retrieve the box. Created from the very heart of the flame the key took on a life of its own. Pandora. A child. Nether living nor dead. I grew to love her, Spartan. And she grew to love me as her father. When Zeus came to take the box. I hid Pandora away. I told him that storing the box on the back of Cronos would be the safest place. After all, who could best the titan? I lied. I did it to save my child. Surely you can understand that. It was your triumph using the box that revealed my deceit. Zeus tortured me until I confessed the truth of my beloved Pandora he took her away, leaving me alone in my torment. Don't you understand? If you take her to the flame...

Speaker: KRATOS
Text: Understand this, smith god. I will stop at nothing to destroy Zeus.

Speaker: HEPHAESTUS
Text: But if you... You are right Spartan. If it means the death of Zeus, I’d be happy to help you. Perhaps... Yes. Yes. Of course. We’ll need the Omphalos stone. With it I’ll make you a weapon.

Speaker: KRATOS
Text: I have weapons.

Speaker: HEPHAESTUS
Text: Ah... But not like this. This weapon will give you the retribution you so rightly deserve. The stone rests in the pit of tartarus. Bring it to me, and I will heep you.
[Kratos plunges into the depths of tartarus in search of the stone.]

Speaker: TITAN
Text: The murderer of Gaia enters my tomb?

Speaker: KRATOS
Text: Cronos!

Speaker: CRONOS
Text: I know it was you who killed her, Spartan. Who else could? I live in torment because of you. After you took the box from Pandora’s temple, Zeus was consumed with fear. He banished me to the pits of tartarus.

Speaker: KRATOS
Text: I was tasked by the gods to kill Ares.

Speaker: CRONOS
Text: You killed Ares out of your need for vengeance. But this time, retribution finally comes to me, Spartan. Kratos, your death will not be a gentle one. My eyes! Damn mortal! You will suffer when my sight returns.  you little bastard! There you are, Kratos! Your fate is now in my hands! I will make you into a bloody stain. Kratos! Where did you go? By hiding you show your true nature coward! Why do you flee, Kratos? There is no escape. I know that you are here somewhere. Kratos! Where are you? Enough. It is time to end this. Trust me. Eating you will be more unpleasant for me!
[Allowing to eat himself, Kratos finds a stone and cuts Cronos from the inside, getting out.]

Speaker: CRONOS
Text: You have what you came for! Let me be!
[But Kratos does not even think to stop. He pierces Cronos' jaw with the fastening of his chain, thanks to which the temple of Pandora hangs on his neck.]

Speaker: CRONOS
Text: Curse these chains! I should have expected this from a coward such as yourself. A coward who kills his own kin. Kratos! No!
[Kratos pierces Cronos’ forehead with the sword of Olympus and kills him, after which he returns to the forge.]

Speaker: HEPHAESTUS
Text: Kratos?

Speaker: KRATOS
Text: You sent me to my death?

Speaker: HEPHAESTUS
Text: No, no, no. Calm yourself, Kratos. I knew you were up to the challenge. I truly needed omphalos stone. You'll see.

Speaker: KRATOS
Text: Make it quick, old man!

Speaker: HEPHAESTUS
Text: A weapon such as this can't be rushed. This will be worth the wait. A fine weapon like no other. As I promised.
[Hephaestus gives Kratos a new weapon and taking advantage of the moment attacks him.]

Speaker: HEPHAESTUS
Text: Here is your retribution!
[But Kratos deals with the decrepit and exhausted god of blacksmiths with ease.]

Speaker: HEPHAESTUS
Text: My beautiful Pandora. Please spare her. Pandora... Forgive me…

Speaker: HERA
Text: You! I told him to kill you. I told him the day you were born to kill you. But he would not have it. My stupid husband took pity. And now look what you have wrought! Look at this! Look at it!  they're dying because of you. Everything is dying because of you. The sun is gone. The oceans swallow the land. Disease infects what remains. I am doing all I can to keep them alive. But you... Your ruthless murdering of the gods has caused all of this! You think this garden is not protected? Your brute strength may have bested Hercules. But your simple mind will never find a way out. I look forward to watching you die here, as an old man.
[However, Hera clearly underestimated Kratos. He solves the riddle of the gardens.]

Speaker: HERA
Text: You simple... Mortal... How dare you challenge us? You think you can just walk away? We aren’t finished!  what have you done? What have you done to me? You coward. You destroy all you touch. Good luck with that little whore you call Pandora!
Action: (he pushes Hera and her tiara breaks)

Text: [Kratos lose patience and he breaks Hera's neck.]

Speaker: DAEDALUS
Text: The gift of Hades the liquid fire that is what is first. Next, next, I will take the gift of Boreas the ice storm. That will give me the lower the power to bring my son back to me. My son! My beautiful Icarus? Ah... Good, good. You have the ice storm. The scorpion must be defeated. The ice storm, that is the secret of the labyrinth... To escape it, we must assemble it! Good, you've already started. I've seen the cubes moving into place now. Once inside. You must use the gift of Boreas it is the catalyst that drives the labyrinth.
[Kratos comes closer and daedalus realizes that this is not Icarus.]

Speaker: DAEDALUS
Text: You're not... But you... What have you done with my child. My boy! Where is my boy?

Speaker: KRATOS
Text: Your son is dead, daedalus.

Speaker: DAEDALUS
Text: My boy… my child... No. No. No. I took the gift of Hades - the liquid fire. And the ice storm to create the power of the labyrinth. Create the power! The power to create... The power to destroy... The king of the gods has forsaken me. He said that if I built the labyrinth I would see the return of my son! He said... He said that if I took the liquid fire… my boy. Oh my child... Please don’t do it Spartan!
[Kratos solves the labyrinth puzzle and kills daedalus. Going inside he finds Pandora lying on the floor.]

Speaker: KRATOS
Text: Pandora? What has he done?

Speaker: PANDORA
Text: He told me never talk to you again! He told me if I did, he would hurt you the way he hurt my father.

Speaker: KRATOS
Text: He won’t.

Speaker: PANDORA
Text: He told me he would kill you.

Speaker: KRATOS
Text: He can’t. We must leave this place.

Speaker: PANDORA
Text: Come. I can show you the way. Thank you, Kratos.

Speaker: KRATOS
Text: Our journey is far from over, Pandora. By its end you will not be thanking me.

Speaker: PANDORA
Text: I know I look it, but I’m not a child, Kratos. I have seen many terrible things. I’m not afraid. I understand what lies ahead. I saw Zeus torture my father. I saw him beaten because of me. I should’ve helped him but I was afraid.

Speaker: KRATOS
Text: Hephaestus did what every father should do. Protect his child.

Speaker: PANDORA
Text: No. It’s all my fault. I failed him because of fear. Fear is it’s own kind of darkness. In that darkness I heard what the gods said about me. They called me a monster.

Speaker: KRATOS
Text: Words mean nothing.

Speaker: PANDORA
Text: Perhaps but in their words I heard fear. The fear of an ash-covered warrior. The fear of you. As the fear in the gods rose, mine was replaced by hope.

Speaker: KRATOS
Text: Hope is for the weak, Pandora.

Speaker: PANDORA
Text: Hope is what makes us strong. This is why we are here. It is what we fight with when all else is lost.
[Kratos flings open the door and shows Pandora daedalus' body hanging on the chains.]

Speaker: KRATOS
Text: This is what hope delivers, child. You should learn that now.
[They climb to the top of the labyrinth.]

Speaker: PANDORA
Text: The chain, Kratos. My father once told me it maintains the balance of power within Olympus. Break the chain to raise the labyrinth.

Speaker: KRATOS
Text: Wait here.
[Kratos descends to the judges and breaks the chains of balance.]

Speaker: PANDORA
Text: He knows, Kratos! Zeus knows I’ve escaped! Hurry! I can hear him. He’s near please help Kratos! Hurry! Kratos! Help me!
[Kratos quickly returns to the top of the labyrinth.]

Speaker: KRATOS
Text: Pandora! Pandora? Athena?

Speaker: PANDORA
Text: It’s alright, Kratos.

Speaker: SPIRIT OF ATHENA
Text: Remember your purpose, Spartan. Remember why you have come so far. Prepare yourself, Spartan. You know what you must do.

Speaker: KRATOS
Text: I will raise the labyrinth I will take her where she belongs.
[He raises the labyrinth with Pandora on it and opens the way to the box.]

Speaker: PANDORA
Text: There it is. I can see it, Kratos. In the darkness the fires of hope will set us free.
[Pandora runs to the flame of Olympus. Suddenly even for himself, Kratos stops her.]

Speaker: KRATOS
Text: Pandora, no!

Speaker: PANDORA
Text: You know why I’m here! You brought me here to do this!

Speaker: KRATOS
Text: I will find another way!

Speaker: PANDORA
Text: No, Kratos! There is no other way! Let me go!

Speaker: KRATOS
Text: No, child!

Speaker: PANDORA
Text: I am not a child! You’re hurting me!
[She rushes out of Kratos' bear grip and runs off, but stumbles upon Zeus. He grabs her by the throat.]

Speaker: PANDORA
Text: Kratos! Help!

Speaker: KRATOS
Text: Put her down, Zeus!

Speaker: ZEUS
Text: Your obsession with this... This... Thing... Has become somewhat of a nuisance, my son.

Speaker: KRATOS
Text: Release the girl, Zeus!

Speaker: ZEUS
Text: Don’t confuse this… object... This construction of Hephaestus with your own flesh and blood. But perhaps you already have, Spartan. Your quest for Pandora your pathetic attempt for atonement from the family you slaughtered has caused nothing but havoc on Olympus. Look around at what you have done!

Speaker: KRATOS
Text: I see only what I have come to destroy!

Speaker: ZEUS
Text: Taking pity on you has been my greatest mistake, Kratos. Just as taking pity on this thing will prove to be your greatest mistake.

Speaker: KRATOS
Text: This has nothing to do with her.

Speaker: ZEUS
Text: It has everything to do with her.

Speaker: KRATOS
Text: Put her down!

Speaker: ZEUS
Text: As you wish.
[He throws Pandora aside and begin the bloody battle that we all have been waiting for.]

Speaker: ZEUS
Text: Surrender to me. And Pandora will live. That thing has used you! Why do you waste your time!
[While they fight Pandora comes to her senses and runs to the flame of Olympus.]

Speaker: KRATOS
Text: Pandora! Pandora, no!

Speaker: ZEUS
Text: Stop her, Kratos! Do not let her into the flame!

Speaker: PANDORA
Text: This is what I am meant to do! You know that! Please.

Speaker: ZEUS
Text: Hush.

Speaker: PANDORA
Text: Kratos, you know this is the only way.

Speaker: ZEUS
Text: Don’t listen to her, Kratos. For once in your pathetic life, don't fail. Don't fail her like you failed your family.
[Kratos screams from the bottom of his heart and throws Pandora into the fire. He runs to attack Zeus with his bare hands.]

Speaker: KRATOS
Text: Pandora!
[When he regains consciousness, he sees that the flame has disappeared and access to the Pandora's box is granted. He opens it, but it is empty.]

Speaker: KRATOS
Text: The power to kill a god.

Speaker: ZEUS
Text: Empty? After all you have sought. After all you have sacrificed. It ends in another stunning failure.  Such chaos... I will have much to do after I kill you.

Speaker: KRATOS
Text: Face me, Father. It is time to end this.

Speaker: ZEUS
Text: Yes my son. It is time.
[They fight again, but Gaia suddenly appears.]

Speaker: GAIA
Text: The reign of Olympus ends now!

Speaker: KRATOS
Text: Gaia! You live?

Speaker: GAIA
Text: My world. It bleeds because of you. I never sought your death, Spartan, but you have left me no choice.

Speaker: ZEUS
Text: Your pawn has failed you, Gaia. Perhaps you should have chosen the other one!

Speaker: GAIA
Text: Enough. Father and son will die together.
[Gaia breaks the terrace on which Kratos and Zeus stood, and they jump inside her. Kratos wants to break the heart of Gaia with his own hands, but Zeus stands in his way.]

Speaker: GAIA
Text: Kratos.

Speaker: ZEUS
Text: I’ll put an end to this chaos. Die! Insolent fool! I will break you!
[Kratos defeats Zeus and pierces him with the sword of Olympus, along with the heart of Gaia. However, the father of Olympus does not even think of dying. His spirit comes out of the body.]

Speaker: SPIRIT OF ZEUS
Text: I grew weary of you, my son.
[He deprives him of all accumulated artifacts and grabs his throat.]

Speaker: SPIRIT OF ZEUS
Text: I created you and I will be your end! Let the fear inside, Kratos!
[He kills him and sends him to Max Payne’s world of nightmares.]

Speaker: SPIRIT OF ZEUS
Text: Nothing but darkness lies ahead Kratos.
[Kratos finds his family.]

Speaker: CALLIOPE
Text: Mother! What’s happening outside? The people! The fires!

Speaker: KRATOS’ WIFE
Text: Shhh. Stay close, calliope.

Speaker: CALLIOPE
Text: Mother, I’m scared. Are they coming to get us?

Speaker: KRATOS’ WIFE
Text: Your father will protect us.

Speaker: YOUNG KRATOS
Text: Burn this village! Burn it to the ground!

Speaker: CALLIOPE
Text: Daddy?

Speaker: KRATOS’ WIFE
Text: Kratos?
[Kratos kills his family offscreen.]

Speaker: CALLIOPE
Text: Father, no! No father, no!

Speaker: KRATOS
Text: My wife. My child... How? They were left in Sparta.

Speaker: YOUNG KRATOS
Text: Ares!

Speaker: SPIRIT OF PANDORA
Text: Hurry! I can help, Kratos. Kratos. In the darkness the fires of hope will set us free.
[She burns in a blue flame. Kratos lights the lamp from this flame and goes on.]

Speaker: KRATOS’ WIFE
Text: You can see the light. It is changing you. It is time to lay your fears to rest. The light reveals the truth. The power of forgiveness comes from within. To be forgiven, you must find the power to forgive yourself.
[She hugs him and burns in the blue flame. Kratos goes further and sees the scene of the murder of Athena.]

Speaker: ATHENA
Text: No, Kratos! Stop!

Speaker: YOUNG KRATOS
Text: Athena! No!

Speaker: ATHENA
Text: Kratos, fear drove Zeus to kill his father, Cronos. The same fear that brought the great war. A fear that drove Zeus to kill you, his own son. Zeus uses fear to keep you in the dark. Confront your demons and lay them to rest.
[She burns in the blue flame.]

Speaker: SPIRIT OF PANDORA
Text: Over here, Kratos.
[Kratos walks over the edge, looks down and says the legendary phrase from the first game.]

Speaker: KRATOS
Text: The gods of Olympus have abandoned me. Now there is…
[He jumps into the abyss, but does not dies. He enters the ocean full of blood, where the souls of those who he killed cry out to him. He swims this ocean.]

Speaker: SPIRIT
Text: Kratos!

Speaker: BARBARIAN
Text: Do you remember that day Spartan?

Speaker: HEPHAESTUS
Text: I won't allow you to hurt her.

Speaker: HERA
Text: Good luck with that little whore you call Pandora!

Speaker: SISTER OF FATE
Text: You cannot change your destiny, mortal!

Speaker: SPIRIT
Text: I gave you everything!

Speaker: SPIRIT
Text: Please don't do it Spartan!

Speaker: CRONOS
Text: You have what you came for! Let me be!

Speaker: SPIRIT
Text: Die, Spartan!

Speaker: HERMES
Text: Today you may defeat me, but in the end, Kratos, in the end you'll betray only yourself.

Speaker: TYPHON
Text: You will pay for that, Kratos!

Speaker: SPIRIT OF PANDORA
Text: Come. I can show you the way.

Speaker: SPIRIT
Text: Die, Kratos!

Speaker: ZEUS
Text: I created you and I will be your end!

Speaker: SPIRIT OF PANDORA
Text: Hurry!

Speaker: ZEUS
Text: Why won’t you die! Die! Tremble in fear.

Speaker: SPIRIT OF PANDORA
Text: Kratos! Over here, Kratos. Hurry, Kratos! Kratos, please. I need you to free me.

Speaker: ZEUS
Text: Don't listen to her, Kratos. For once in your pathetic life, don't fail. Don't fail her like you failed your family.

Speaker: SPIRIT OF PANDORA
Text: It's alright, Kratos. Kratos, you know this is the only way. As the fear in the gods rose, mine was replaced by hope.
[Kratos swims up to Pandora's box.]

Speaker: KRATOS
Text: The power to kill a god.
[He opens the box and jumps back through his life to the world of living.]

Speaker: SPIRIT OF PANDORA
Text: Hope is what makes us strong. This is why we are here. It is what we fight with when all else is lost.

[His hands burn with a blue flame. Now he is ready to fight with Zeus. He beats him with such force and hatred, that turns him into a bloody mess. With the death of father of Olympus, real chaos begin to reign on earth.]

Speaker: SPIRIT OF ATHENA
Text: You have done well, Kratos. Freed from the bondage of Olympus and cleansed in chaos. Mankind is now ready to hear my message.

Speaker: KRATOS
Text: Look around you, Athena. The world stands in ruin. What good is your message?

Speaker: SPIRIT OF ATHENA
Text: Go if you must, but first I insist you give me the power from inside the box.

Speaker: KRATOS
Text: The box was empty.

Speaker: SPIRIT OF ATHENA
Text: That can’t be true. I can see it in your eyes. You used my power to kill Zeus. You still have it as we speak. Don’t you understand? When Zeus gathered all the evils and placed them in the box. I dreaded what would happen if it was opened again. And so, I summoned the most powerful weapon in the world and I placed it in the box.

Speaker: KRATOS
Text: I told you, it was empty. Pandora was sacrificed in vain. She died because of my need for vengeance.

Speaker: SPIRIT OF ATHENA
Text: You must be mistaken. You used my power to kill Zeus. I saw you do it. Unless... Of course. When you opened the box you released the evils to the gods. Infected them. Changed them. Zeus himself fell prey to the dark evils. This is why he became so enraged and obsessed with your death. He was consumed by the evil, fear. I thought the power I placed in the box was never released all these years I assumed you drew from the evils inside to destroy Ares. But I was wrong… the power you took from the box is mine. From it you gained the strength that Zeus could never destroy. A strength great enough to overcome fear. Locked deep inside of you Kratos, is hope. It has remained buried, trapped by your guilt and the failures of your past. When you kill Zeus, you must have allowed something to awaken it. What was it, Kratos?

Speaker: PANDORA
Text: Hope is what makes us strong. This is why we are here. It is what we fight with when all else is lost.

Speaker: SPIRIT OF ATHENA
Text: What was it, Kratos?

Speaker: KRATOS
Text: All I remember is what I have lost.

Speaker: SPIRIT OF ATHENA
Text: That is why you should give me the power. I understand its true meaning and where it belongs. Trust you to do the right thing, Kratos.

Speaker: KRATOS
Text: You shouldn't.

Speaker: SPIRIT OF ATHENA
Text: You owe me this, Kratos.

Speaker: KRATOS
Text: I owe you nothing!

Speaker: SPIRIT OF ATHENA
Text: I made you a god. I sheltered you from the wrath of Olympus. I delivered your revenge on Zeus.

Speaker: KRATOS
Text: It is over, Athena.

Speaker: SPIRIT OF ATHENA
Text: You would dare strike me down, again?

Speaker: KRATOS
Text: My vengeance ends now.

Speaker: SPIRIT OF ATHENA
Text: Kratos, no!
[Kratos swings his sword and pierces himself through.]

Speaker: SPIRIT OF ATHENA
Text: You fool! What have you done?
[The power of hope leaves Kratos and spreads around the world.]

Speaker: SPIRIT OF ATHENA
Text: No! That was meant for me! They will not know what to do with it! You disappoint me, Spartan.
[She leaves. Kratos slowly dies in a pool of his own blood... But a moment later we see that Kratos' body has disappeared.]
